headline: Dow Moves To A Crisis Footing As Downside Risks Build (Rating Downgrade)
summary: Dow struggles with weak pricing, manufacturing, and China's market downturn. Dividend risks rise as cost cuts intensify. Read more on DOW stock here.

headline: Dow (NYSE:DOW) Reports Q1 Sales Drop To US$10 Billion With US$307 Million Net Loss
summary: Dow Inc. (NYSE:DOW) reported a challenging first quarter of 2025, showing a decline in sales and a net loss, contrasting sharply with last year's profit. Despite these announcements, the company experienced a 6% price surge over the last week. This movement aligns closely with broader market gains, where the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 1%. The general upswing was driven by positive investor sentiment amid earnings reports and potential tariff rollbacks. While Dow's results reflected a...

headline: Dow widens European assets review, delays Canada project to lower costs
summary: Along with other chemicals firms, Dow has been struggling with higher feedstock and energy costs as well as weak demand and prices for its products, especially in markets such as Europe.  Dow has initiated several steps to help mitigate the impact of lackluster demand and margin pressures and reduce spending, including job cuts and a strategic review of some of its European assets.  It said on Thursday that it was expanding the scope of the review and has identified three initial assets - two in Germany and one in the UK - that it believes will require further action, including idling or complete shutdowns.

raw.headline: Dow widens European assets review, delays Canada project to lower costs

It said on Thursday that it was expanding the scope of the review and has identified three initial assets - two in Germany and one in the UK - that it believes will require further action, including idling or complete shutdowns.

headline: Dow Inc.: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: DOW) on Thursday reported a loss of $307 million in its first quarter. On a per-share basis, the Midland, Michigan-based company said it had a loss of 44 cents. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs and non-recurring costs, came to 2 cents per share.
